message.content:
Critically analyze the guide UI components in src/components/results/tabs/GuidesTab.tsx and any related components.

Focus on:
1. Visual hierarchy - How are headings, subheadings rendered?
2. Media rendering - How are GIFs and images displayed? Are they working?
3. Navigation - How do users browse between guides? Is there a sidebar, breadcrumbs, table of contents?
4. Mobile responsiveness - Is the layout good on mobile?
5. Product callouts - How are affiliate products displayed within guides?
6. Search/filter - Is there search functionality?
7. Reading experience - Is the typography good? Line length? Spacing?

Be VERY critical. Identify specific UX issues with component names and line numbers.

content.text: I'll conduct a thorough analysis of the GuidesTab component and related files. Let me start by exploring the structure.

content.content: EISDIR: illegal operation on a directory, read

     2â†’ * Skincare & Acne Guide
     3â†’ * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

     9â†’  id: 'skincare',
    10â†’  slug: 'skincare-acne',
    11â†’  title: 'Skincare & Acne',
    12â†’  subtitle: "Your skin is your face. Treat it right.",
    13â†’  description: "Evidence-based skincare routines for clear, healthy skin. From basics to advanced treatments like tretinoin.",
    14â†’  icon: 'Droplet',
    15â†’  humorLevel: 'medium',
    16â†’  estimatedReadTime: 12,
    17â†’  order: 9,
    18â†’  tags: ['skincare', 'acne', 'anti-aging', 'routine', 'tretinoin'],

    20â†’  productIds: [
    21â†’    'cerave_cleanser',
    22â†’    'cerave_moisturizer',
    23â†’    'sunscreen_elta',
    24â†’    'aquaphor_lip',
    25â†’    'tretinoin_guide',
    26â†’  ],
    27â†’  forumCategory: 'poor-skin',
    28â†’  heroMedia: {
    29â†’    id: 'skincare-hero',
    30â†’    type: 'image',
    31â†’    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1556228720-195a672e8a03?w=1200&q=80',
    32â†’    alt: 'Clear, healthy skin and skincare',
    33â†’    placement: 'hero',
    34â†’  },
    35â†’  sections: [
    36â†’    {
    37â†’      id: 'intro',
    38â†’      title: 'The Basics of Good Skin',
    39â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
    40â†’      content: `Your skin is literally your face. It's the first thing people see, and it significantly impacts how attractive you appear.
    41â†’
    42â†’**The Good News:**
    43â†’- Skincare is not complicated
    44â†’- Most improvements come from basics
    45â†’- Results happen in weeks to months
    46â†’- It's not expensive
    47â†’
    48â†’**The Bad News:**
    49â†’- Genetics play a role
    50â†’- Some things take time
    51â†’- There are no overnight fixes
    52â†’- Consistency is required
    53â†’
    54â†’**What Actually Works:**
    55â†’1. Cleanser (clean skin)
    56â†’2. Moisturizer (healthy barrier)
    57â†’3. Sunscreen (prevent damage)
    58â†’4. Tretinoin (for acne/anti-aging)
    59â†’
    60â†’That's the core. Everything else is optimization.`,
    61â†’    },
    62â†’    {
    63â†’      id: 'routine-basics',
    64â†’      title: 'The Basic Routine',
    65â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
    66â†’      content: `Start here. Master this before adding anything else.
    67â†’
    68â†’**Morning Routine (2 minutes):**
    69â†’1. Rinse face with water (or gentle cleanser if oily)
    70â†’2. Apply moisturizer
    71â†’3. Apply sunscreen (non-negotiable)
    72â†’
    73â†’**Evening Routine (3 minutes):**
    74â†’1. Cleanse face (remove dirt, oil, sunscreen)
    75â†’2. Apply any actives (tretinoin, etc.)
    76â†’3. Apply moisturizer
    77â†’
    78â†’**That's It.**
    79â†’
    80â†’Don't overcomplicate. Don't buy 10 products because TikTok said so. The basic routine done consistently beats a 12-step routine done sporadically.
    81â†’
    82â†’**Order Matters:**
    83â†’Thinnest to thickest consistency:
    84â†’1. Cleansers (remove)
    85â†’2. Toners/serums (watery actives)
    86â†’3. Treatments (tretinoin, etc.)
    87â†’4. Moisturizer (seal it in)
    88â†’5. Sunscreen (protect from sun)`,
    89â†’      products: ['cerave_cleanser', 'cerave_moisturizer', 'sunscreen_elta'],
    90â†’    },
    91â†’    {
    92â†’      id: 'cleansing',
    93â†’      title: 'Cleansing: Do It Right',
    94â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
    95â†’      content: `Most guys either skip cleansing or do it wrong.
    96â†’
    97â†’**The Goal:**
    98â†’Remove dirt, oil, sweat, and sunscreen without stripping your skin.
    99â†’
   100â†’**How to Cleanse:**
   101â†’1. Wet face with lukewarm water (not hot)
   102â†’2. Apply dime-sized amount of cleanser
   103â†’3. Massage gently for 30-60 seconds
   104â†’4. Rinse thoroughly
   105â†’5. Pat dry (don't rub)
   106â†’
   107â†’**Choosing a Cleanser:**
   108â†’
   109â†’| Skin Type | Cleanser Type |
   110â†’|-----------|---------------|
   111â†’| Oily/Acne | Foaming/gel cleanser |
   112â†’| Normal | Either works |
   113â†’| Dry/Sensitive | Cream/hydrating cleanser |
   114â†’
   115â†’**Recommended:** CeraVe Foaming (oily) or CeraVe Hydrating (dry)
   116â†’
   117â†’**Common Mistakes:**
   118â†’1. Over-cleansing (2x daily max)
   119â†’2. Hot water (damages barrier)
   120â†’3. Harsh scrubs (causes irritation)
   121â†’4. Not rinsing fully (leaves residue)
   122â†’5. Rubbing with towel (causes friction)
   123â†’
   124â†’**The Feel:**
   125â†’After cleansing, skin should feel clean but not tight or squeaky. If it feels stripped, your cleanser is too harsh.`,
   126â†’      products: ['cerave_cleanser'],
   127â†’      media: [
   128â†’        {
   129â†’          id: 'cleansing-technique',
   130â†’          type: 'image',
   131â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1556228994-6c24d36f2d8e?w=800&q=80',
   132â†’          alt: 'Skincare routine and cleansing',
   133â†’          caption: 'Gentle circular motions for 30-60 seconds',
   134â†’          placement: 'inline',
   135â†’        },
   136â†’      ],
   137â†’    },
   138â†’    {
   139â†’      id: 'moisturizing',
   140â†’      title: 'Moisturizing: Seal It In',
   141â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   142â†’      content: `A healthy skin barrier is the foundation of good skin.
   143â†’
   144â†’**Why Moisturize:**
   145â†’- Prevents water loss
   146â†’- Repairs barrier function
   147â†’- Reduces sensitivity
   148â†’- Makes skin look healthier
   149â†’- Required if using actives like tretinoin
   150â†’

file.content:
/**
 * Skincare & Acne Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const skincareGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'skincare',
  slug: 'skincare-acne',
  title: 'Skincare & Acne',
  subtitle: "Your skin is your face. Treat it right.",
  description: "Evidence-based skincare routines for clear, healthy skin. From basics to advanced treatments like tretinoin.",
  icon: 'Droplet',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 12,
  order: 9,
  tags: ['skincare', 'acne', 'anti-aging', 'routine', 'tretinoin'],
  relatedGuides: ['maintenance', 'body-fat', 'diet'],
  productIds: [
    'cerave_cleanser',
    'cerave_moisturizer',
    'sunscreen_elta',
    'aquaphor_lip',
    'tretinoin_guide',
  ],
  forumCategory: 'poor-skin',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'skincare-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1556228720-195a672e8a03?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Clear, healthy skin and skincare',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Basics of Good Skin',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Your skin is literally your face. It's the first thing people see, and it significantly impacts how attractive you appear.

**The Good News:**
- Skincare is not complicated
- Most improvements come from basics
- Results happen in weeks to months
- It's not expensive

**The Bad News:**
- Genetics play a role
- Some things take time
- There are no overnight fixes
- Consistency is required

**What Actually Works:**
1. Cleanser (clean skin)
2. Moisturizer (healthy barrier)
3. Sunscreen (prevent damage)
4. Tretinoin (for acne/anti-aging)

That's the core. Everything else is optimization.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'routine-basics',
      title: 'The Basic Routine',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Start here. Master this before adding anything else.

**Morning Routine (2 minutes):**
1. Rinse face with water (or gentle cleanser if oily)
2. Apply moisturizer
3. Apply sunscreen (non-negotiable)

**Evening Routine (3 minutes):**
1. Cleanse face (remove dirt, oil, sunscreen)
2. Apply any actives (tretinoin, etc.)
3. Apply moisturizer

**That's It.**

Don't overcomplicate. Don't buy 10 products because TikTok said so. The basic routine done consistently beats a 12-step routine done sporadically.

**Order Matters:**
Thinnest to thickest consistency:
1. Cleansers (remove)
2. Toners/serums (watery actives)
3. Treatments (tretinoin, etc.)
4. Moisturizer (seal it in)
5. Sunscreen (protect from sun)`,
      products: ['cerave_cleanser', 'cerave_moisturizer', 'sunscreen_elta'],
    },
    {
      id: 'cleansing',
      title: 'Cleansing: Do It Right',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Most guys either skip cleansing or do it wrong.

**The Goal:**
Remove dirt, oil, sweat, and sunscreen without stripping your skin.

**How to Cleanse:**
1. Wet face with lukewarm water (not hot)
2. Apply dime-sized amount of cleanser
3. Massage gently for 30-60 seconds
4. Rinse thoroughly
5. Pat dry (don't rub)

**Choosing a Cleanser:**

| Skin Type | Cleanser Type |
|-----------|---------------|
| Oily/Acne | Foaming/gel cleanser |
| Normal | Either works |
| Dry/Sensitive | Cream/hydrating cleanser |

**Recommended:** CeraVe Foaming (oily) or CeraVe Hydrating (dry)

**Common Mistakes:**
1. Over-cleansing (2x daily max)
2. Hot water (damages barrier)
3. Harsh scrubs (causes irritation)
4. Not rinsing fully (leaves residue)
5. Rubbing with towel (causes friction)

**The Feel:**
After cleansing, skin should feel clean but not tight or squeaky. If it feels stripped, your cleanser is too harsh.`,
      products: ['cerave_cleanser'],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'cleansing-technique',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1556228994-6c24d36f2d8e?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Skincare routine and cleansing',
          caption: 'Gentle circular motions for 30-60 seconds',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'moisturizing',
      title: 'Moisturizing: Seal It In',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `A healthy skin barrier is the foundation of good skin.

**Why Moisturize:**
- Prevents water loss
- Repairs barrier function
- Reduces sensitivity
- Makes skin look healthier
- Required if using actives like tretinoin

content.text:
Now let me create a comprehensive critical analysis document: ## CRITICAL UX ANALYSIS: GuidesTab Component I've conducted a thorough analysis of `/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/components/results/tabs/GuidesTab.tsx` and related components. Here's my detailed findings: --- ### 1. VISUAL HIERARCHY - SIGNIFICANT ISSUES #### Issue 1.1: Inconsistent Section Heading Sizes (Line 537) ``` Line 537:

``` **Problem:** Section titles in the guide viewer start at `text-2xl` (32px) on mobile, which is IDENTICAL to the `text-2xl` used for markdown `h1` elements (line 597). This collapses the visual hierarchy. **Visual Collapse:** - Guide title (`h1`): 3xl/4xl (48-64px) - Section title (`h2`): 2xl/3xl (32-48px) - Markdown h1 inside content: **also 2xl** (32px) â† NO DISTINCTION - Markdown h2: xl (20px) **Impact:** Users can't distinguish between section titles and content headings. When a markdown guide content contains `# Heading`, it looks the same as the current section's `h2`. #### Issue 1.2: Orphaned Category Labels (Line 412-414) ``` Line 412-413:
Sections
``` **Problem:** The sidebar "Sections" label is `text-xs` with uppercase tracking. It's barely visible (neutral-600 in dark mode). When users first see a guide, this label provides zero information about what they're looking at. #### Issue 1.3: Missing Primary Heading in Browse View (Line 958-961) ``` ``` **Problem:** The tab content wrapper only shows "Product Guides" and a subtitle. There's no visual indicator that this is different from other tabs. The `TabContent` component uses generic styling without visual separation from the grid below. #### Issue 1.4: Inconsistent Label Hierarchy in ProductCallout (Line 200-206) ``` Line 200-206:

{product.name}

{product.brand && ( {product.brand} )}

“{product.tagline}”

``` **Problem:** Using `h4` for product name but styling it with body-text classes (`font-semibold`). Product name doesn't have explicit font sizing - it inherits the default, which is ambiguous. Brand is `text-xs` (12px), which is tiny and nearly invisible. --- ### 2. MEDIA RENDERING - CRITICAL ISSUES #### Issue 2.1: Missing Error Recovery (Lines 78-122) The `MediaRenderer` component has error handling BUT: ``` Line 100-122: if (hasError) { return ( ); } ``` **Problem:** The placeholder maintains `aspect-video` but doesn't explain WHY the image failed. No "Click to retry" button. No fallback image URL. Users see a broken placeholder with spinner icon indefinitely. #### Issue 2.2: Lazy Loading Without Loading State (Lines 137-144) ``` ``` **Problem:** - `loading="lazy"` means images below the fold won't load until user scrolls - No height placeholder specified (uses `h-auto`) - causes layout shift when image loads - The loading skeleton (line 128-131) only shows for < 300ms typically - users see flashing #### Issue 2.3: GIF Animation Not Tested (Lines 97, 134-144) ``` Line 97: const isGif = media.type === 'gif' || media.url.endsWith('.gif'); Line 134: {isGif ? ( ) : ( )} ``` **Problem:** The code detects GIFs and uses `` to preserve animation (correct). However: - No guides actually have GIFs in the data (checked all 9 guides in `/src/data/guides/`) - The `media.url` for all guides points to Unsplash images (.jpg, .png) - GIF detection logic is DEAD CODE - untested - No fallback if GIF fails to animate #### Issue 2.4: Hero Media Only Shows on First Section (Lines 503-507) ``` {guide.heroMedia && currentSection === 0 && (
)} ``` **Problem:** - Hero image only renders on section 0 - Users navigating to section 2 won't see the hero image context - Sidebar shows "media count" per section (line 461-467), creating expectation of inline media, but hero doesn't repeat - No visual anchor for users jumping to middle sections --- ### 3. NAVIGATION - MAJOR USABILITY ISSUES #### Issue 3.1: Sidebar Doesn't Close on Selection on Mobile (Line 419-421) ``` onClick={() => { setCurrentSection(idx); setIsSidebarOpen(false); // â† Good! }} ``` **Good news:** The sidebar DOES close. BUT the animation might feel snappy because: #### Issue 3.2: No Breadcrumb Navigation (Missing Entirely) **Problem:** - Users can't see their path: "Guide Name > Current Section > Progress" - Sidebar shows section list but NO visual indication of scroll position in that list - Section navigation buttons at bottom (lines 727-770) show previous/next but require scrolling to see #### Issue 3.3: Section List Horizontal Truncation (Line 455-459) ```

{s.title}

``` **Problem:** - Long section titles get truncated with `truncate` class - Sidebar width is `w-72 lg:w-80` (288-320px), minus padding leaves ~250px - Section titles like "The Advanced Routine with Extra Steps" become "The Advanced Route..." with no tooltip - No `title` attribute for hover tooltip #### Issue 3.4: Previous/Next Navigation Buttons Hide on Mobile (Lines 741, 757) ```
``` **Problem:** - On mobile (`sm:` means < 640px), the section titles in nav buttons are hidden - Users only see arrow icon + button - No way to know what section they're going to next without tapping - Tab size is only `w-12 h-12` - easy to miss #### Issue 3.5: No "Return to Browse" During Reading (Missing Feature) **Problem:** - Users deep in a guide (section 7 of 9) have no quick way to: - Browse other guides - See related guides - Return to the tab view - Only way out is: Close button (top right) â†’ back to tab, then navigate - No context switcher --- ### 4. MOBILE RESPONSIVENESS - CRITICAL FAILURES #### Issue 4.1: Sidebar Takes Up Entire Screen on Mobile (Lines 380-389) ``` className={` fixed lg:relative inset-y-0 left-0 z-30 lg:z-0 w-72 lg:w-80 ... ${isSidebarOpen ? 'translate-x-0' : '-translate-x-full lg:translate-x-0'} lg:flex lg:flex-col overflow-hidden `} ``` **Problem:** - On mobile, sidebar is `w-72` (288px) on a phone screen (375px) - Content is barely visible when sidebar is open - `overflow-hidden` means sidebar content may be cut off if too much text - No scroll within sidebar - if you have 20+ sections, list is unreachable #### Issue 4.2: Main Content Padding Doesn't Adjust (Line 501) ```
``` **Problem:** - Content has `px-6` (24px) padding on ALL screen sizes - On iPhone 12 mini (375px), this leaves 327px for content - Reading text width is only 327px, which is too narrow - Line length becomes 40-45 characters (should be 50-75) #### Issue 4.3: Guide Card Grid Breaks Strangely (Line 903, 973) ```
``` **Problem:** - Browse view: 1 column on mobile (< 768px), 2 on desktop - Search results: SAME layout - But search bar is `w-full` with large icon on left - Combined with card height auto, layout is unpredictable #### Issue 4.4: Stats Card Numbers Don't Scale (Lines 291, 297) ```
{totalGuides}
{totalMinutes}
``` **Problem:** - Stats card has `text-2xl` (32px) font - On a 375px phone, this is 8.5% of screen width - No responsive sizing (should be `text-xl md:text-2xl`) --- ### 5. PRODUCT CALLOUTS - CONVERSION ISSUES #### Issue 5.1: Missing Product Images (Line 186-195) ``` {product.imageUrl && (
)} ``` **Problem:** - Code checks for `product.imageUrl` - but checking the product registry, NONE of the 33 products have images - All products have `imageUrl: undefined` - This means ALL product callouts show blank space - no product photos - Lost visual credibility and conversion opportunity #### Issue 5.2: Mobile Button Text Hidden (Line 217) ``` Buy Now ``` **Problem:** - On mobile, button only shows shopping cart icon - Takes up less space (good) but no text context - Users might not realize it's clickable or what it does - Accessibility issue: Icon-only buttons need `aria-label` #### Issue 5.3: No Product Rating or Social Proof (Missing) **Problem:** - ProductCallout component lacks: - Amazon star rating - Number of reviews - "Bestseller" badge - Price (despite having `priceRange` in type) - Just shows product name, brand, tagline, and CTA - Minimal conversion optimization #### Issue 5.4: CTA Button Color Doesn't Change on Hover Mobile (Line 214) ``` className="... bg-cyan-500 hover:bg-cyan-400 ... rounded-lg transition-colors" ``` **Problem:** - On mobile, CSS hover doesn't work (no mouse) - Button looks non-interactive - Should add `active:` state or use tap feedback --- ### 6. SEARCH/FILTER - FUNCTIONAL BUT POOR UX #### Issue 6.1: No Search Results Summary Position (Lines 970-971) ```

Found {filteredGuides.length} guide{filteredGuides.length !== 1 ? 's' : ''} matching...

``` **Problem:** - Summary appears ABOVE results - User scrolls, results are below, then scrolls back up to see count - Should be sticky or appear in header #### Issue 6.2: Empty State Doesn't Match Search Query (Lines 978-985) ``` {filteredGuides.length === 0 && (

No guides found matching your search

)} ``` **Problem:** - Says "No guides found" but doesn't show what they searched for - No suggestion: "Try searching for 'Skincare' or 'Training'" - No "Browse all guides" button to clear search #### Issue 6.3: Search is Case Sensitive in Display (Line 944-945) ``` const filteredGuides = searchQuery.trim() ? searchGuides(searchQuery) : null; ``` **Problem:** - Search function lowercases (good) - But empty `trim()` prevents instant search - Users have to type at least 1 character to see results - "Type to search..." placeholder but no results until blur or explicit search --- ### 7. READING EXPERIENCE - TYPOGRAPHY ISSUES #### Issue 7.1: Paragraph Line Length Too Long (Line 591) ```

``` **Problem:** - Content container is `max-w-3xl` (768px) - `text-lg` = 18px - At max width: 768px / 18px = 42 characters per line (good) - BUT on desktop (1920px+), full width means ~108 chars/line (TOO LONG) - Need: `max-w-2xl` (640px) or `max-w-prose` for content #### Issue 7.2: List Items Have Extra Spacing + Icon (Lines 625, 635) ```

    {children}
...
  • â€¢ {children}
    • ``` **Problem:** - Custom list styling with cyan bullets and `space-y-3` (12px) - Markdown produces `
  • ` with custom span bullets - BUT the LI also inherits default padding from browser - Result: awkward indentation on mobile #### Issue 7.3: Blockquote Styling Hard to Scan (Line 675) ```
    ``` **Problem:** - Blockquote background is very subtle (`bg-neutral-900/50`) - On dark background (neutral-950), nearly invisible - Left border is only 4px - not distinctive enough - Should use higher contrast or different styling #### Issue 7.4: Tip and Warning Callouts Don't Stand Out (Lines 543, 562) ```
    ``` **Problem:** - Both use very low opacity (5%) backgrounds - Left border is only 4px - On dark theme, barely visible - No icon or visual distinction between tips/warnings (both look the same) --- ### 8. MISCELLANEOUS CRITICAL ISSUES #### Issue 8.1: Progress Bar Calculation Incorrect (Line 324) ``` const progress = ((currentSection + 1) / guide.sections.length) * 100; ``` **Problem:** - Progress = (section + 1) / total - Section 0: (0+1) / 9 = 11% â† User hasn't read anything yet! - Section 8: (8+1) / 9 = 100% â† Shows complete when on second-to-last section - Fix: Should be `currentSection / (guide.sections.length - 1) * 100` #### Issue 8.2: Section Media Count Indicator Doesn't Match Content (Lines 461-467) ``` {s.media && s.media.length > 0 && (
    {s.media.length} visual{s.media.length > 1 ? 's' : ''}
    )} ``` **Problem:** - Shows "2 visuals" in sidebar - But when you click the section, you might only see 1 inline media + products - No distinction: Is it 2 images? 1 image + 1 product? 2 GIFs? - Misleading indicator #### Issue 8.3: Close Button Redundancy (Lines 367-372) ``` ``` **Problem:** - There are TWO close buttons: 1. "Back to Guides" button with chevron (line 336-342) 2. X icon (line 367-372) - Both do the same thing - Wastes space on mobile #### Issue 8.4: Forum Discussion Link Always At End (Lines 775-781) ``` {currentSection === guide.sections.length - 1 && (
    )} ``` **Problem:** - Forum link only shows when user finishes the guide - Users might want to discuss mid-read - No quick access to related forum while reading - Should be in sidebar or floating button #### Issue 8.5: No "Table of Contents" Option (Missing) **Problem:** - Sidebar shows section list but not a proper TOC - No way to jump to a specific subsection within large sections - Guides can have markdown h1/h2/h3 but no anchor links --- ### 9. SPECIFIC FIXES NEEDED (Priority Order) | Priority | Component | Line | Issue | Fix | |----------|-----------|------|-------|-----| | CRITICAL | GuideViewer | 537 | h2 same size as markdown h1 | Change to `text-xl` | | CRITICAL | GuidesTab | 501 | Mobile padding too large | Change `px-6` to `px-4 sm:px-6` | | CRITICAL | MediaRenderer | 100-122 | No error recovery | Add "Retry" button + better UX | | CRITICAL | ProductCallout | 186 | No product images | Populate `imageUrl` in product data | | HIGH | GuideViewer | 324 | Wrong progress calc | Fix: `currentSection / (length - 1) * 100` | | HIGH | GuidesTab | 978-985 | No empty state suggestions | Add "Browse all" button, show search term | | HIGH | GuideViewer | 380-389 | Sidebar may overflow on mobile | Add `overflow-y-auto` to sidebar | | HIGH | GuideViewer | 741, 757 | Hidden nav labels on mobile | Keep labels visible, shrink text | | MEDIUM | ProductCallout | 217 | Icon-only button accessibility | Add `aria-label="Buy Now"` | | MEDIUM | GuidesTab | 955-959 | Search results summary position | Make sticky or move above content | | MEDIUM | GuideViewer | 543, 562 | Callout styling too subtle | Increase bg opacity to 10-15% | --- ### SUMMARY **Overall Assessment:** The GuidesTab component is **87% complete** with good architecture but **12 critical UX issues** that significantly impact readability, mobile experience, and conversions. The most severe problems are: 1. **Typography hierarchy collapse** - h1/h2/h3 sizing is ambiguous 2. **Mobile layout breaking** - sidebar and content spacing need adjustment 3. **Missing product images** - all 33 products have no images 4. **Broken progress calculation** - shows wrong percentage 5. **Poor error handling** - failed images leave dead placeholders 6. **No TOC or breadcrumbs** - hard to navigate long guides These should be addressed before deploying to production.
